head.title: Treasury Bills Set to Be Offered This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Bills Set to Be Offered This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 3.61 percent and the rate on a six-month bill was 3.87 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 3.61 percent and the rate on a six-month bill was 3.87 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
City Holding Capital Trust II, $50 million of capital securities due in 2028. ---/---/---. Wheat First Butcher Singer Inc.
Nova Chemicals, 8 million $25 preferred shares due in 2047. BAA3/BBB/---. Merrill Lynch.
Raychem Corp., $400 million of notes in 2 parts, consisting of 7-year and 10-year notes. BAA2/A--/---. Morgan Stanley, Dean Witter, Discover & Co.
Source: MCM Corporatewatch
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT
TUESDAY
City of Boston, $120 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Port of Houston, $81 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT
WEDNESDAY
Knox County, Tn., $75 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK

City of South Miami Health Facility Authority, $105 million of debt securities for Baptist Health System. Merrill Lynch.

New York City Municipal Water, $220 million of debt securities. Paine Webber.
Public Utility District No. 1 of Chelan County, Wa., $68 million of refunding revenue bonds. Lehman Brothers.
Sacramento City Finance Authority, $200 million of lease revenue bonds. Merrill Lynch.
Salem, Ore., Hospital Facility, $50 million of revenue bonds. Seattle-Northwest Securities.
San Antonio, $884.7 million of electric and gas refunding revenue bonds. Paine Webber.
State of Illinois, $125 million of general obligation college savings bonds. First Chicago Capital Markets.
Washington Health Facilities Authority, $60 million of revenue bonds for Peacehealth. Ziegler Securities.
Weber County, Utah, IHC Health Services, $150 million of debt securities. J.P. Morgan Securities.
